pullRequest.title: Wait for Rubix initialization in Hive connector
pullRequest.bodyText:
This way we can fail fast whenever Rubix cannot be initialized of configuration is faulty.
Fixes: #3489

nodes.bodyText: this needs to stay for now as cacheReady is still not guaranteed to be true when getFileSystem is called for the first time

Why it's not readable? We use something similar in: io/prestosql/tests/product/launcher/testcontainers/SelectedPortWaitStrategy.java:70. This approach also provides nice exception message

The fact that you needed to put comment means it is not readable. We are throwing "timout" exception ever loop but retry.
I would suggest to use Failesafe's timeout mechanism like described in https://jodah.net/failsafe/execution-cancellation/ . And then catch TimeoutExceededException and wrap it to PrestoException
Why make a field out of it instead using a constant?
shouldn't we just throw here?
I do not understand what you mean here.
Did you test if breaks presto startup in case of failure with @PostConstruct. My understanding is it should but please verify.
This is so that different policy can be used in test
I mean this code needs to stay, I've created and squashed fixup that brings these lines back.

I prefer to be on safe-side (until RubixConfigurationInitializer is fully immutable) and just allow to create uncached FS until Rubix initializes. Rubix now initializes as part of @PostConstruct, but I guess there could be some other init method that needs FS before that happens.
It does fail, checked

The fact that you needed to put comment means it is not readable. We are throwing "timout" exception ever loop but retry.

If I use cancellation mechanism I would have to implement:
while (!condition)
  Thread.sleep()

again. I like how Failsafe manages that for me. Let's discuss
its mutable, so it better be a static factory method, not a constant

commit.message: Use method reference instead of lambda
Use RetryDriver to wait for coordinator node
Extract Rubix startup into separate method

Wait for Rubix to start during Hive connector initialization

This allows to fail-fast if Rubix cannot start of invalid
configuration is provided.
Use @PostConstruct to initialize Rubix instead of explicit method call

afterCommit.message: Use @PostConstruct to initialize Rubix instead of explicit method call
